messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Single Moms?
messages.msgSnippet: I am a single homeschool/now unschool Mom. I d be happy to talk about my expeiences, knowing my story may or may not be of help to you.  I am sorry for your
messages.messageBody:
I am a single homeschool/now unschool Mom. I'd be happy to talk about my expeiences, knowing my story may or may not be of help to you. I am sorry for your sadness.

Cameron, Single mom of Granville, age 13, Emily, age 10, and Burke, age 7.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Single Moms?
messages.msgSnippet: Life Learning Magazine had a wonderful series about a single mom unschooling her (adopted) son, called Freeing Brycen . It is well worth reading -as is the
messages.messageBody:
Life Learning Magazine had a wonderful series about a
single mom unschooling her (adopted) son, called
'Freeing Brycen'. It is well worth reading -as is the
entire magazine!
Good luck,
Mara
--- Wildflower Car <unschoolfool@...> wrote:

> Are any of you single Moms? Or were you raised
> unschooling by a single Mom?
> I am looking at a slight possibility of being one.
> :(
>
> Love and Happiness,
> Wildflower
>

messages.messageBody:
